question: In many countries, traditional foods are being replaced by international fast foods, which has a negative effect on local food culture. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
text: Nowadays, it is increasingly common that people prefer fast foods rather than traditional meals. From my perspective, this trend causes a series of negative impacts on individuals, families and societies.

First of all, as we all know, fast foods are made of ingredients, which include plenty of salts, sugar, as well as fat. People, who are used to eating these desirable but unhealthy foods, are prone to getting health problems, such as obesity, high blood pressure and heart diseases. As the unhealthy proportion of the population increase, as a result, it can place a great burden on the whole society.

Secondly, this development also can pose a threat to local traditional culture. Take China for example, Chinese traditional foods are a significant sign of our culture, many people consider them as a cultural identity of China. However, more and more people, particularly the young generation, are consider it is a waste of time to prepare for traditional meals at home, because it takes more time on preparing and cooking and needs years to get proficient. Consequently, this trend can hinder the continuity of traditional customs.

Lastly, eating fast food impacts domestic relationships in a negative way, because, family members have less time to get together. For instance, in China, preparing and eating dinners is an important opportunity for the whole family to stay together and share their experiences after a hard-working day. As Chinese people eat more fast food, we are losing this habit in families.
In conclusion, although fast foods are convenient and popular, they obviously cause many serious negative impacts on individuals and societies.

error_list.error_des: It seems that the use of particle to may be incorrect here.
It appears that you are missing a comma or two with the interrupter for example. Consider adding the comma(s).
It appears that the form of the verb consider does not work with are in this sentence.
The verb is appears to be unnecessary here.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma before the dependent clause marker because. Consider removing the comma.
